public property public ways and air space over such streets roads highways alleys rightsofway utility easements public property and public ways located within the geographic limits of the city telecommunications means the transmission between or among points specified by the user of information of the users choosing eg data video and voice without change in the form or content of the information sent and received telecommunications facilities or facilities means all conduits manholes poles antennas transceivers wires cable including fiber optic cable and appurtenances owned or utilized by a telecommunications provider and located in under or over the streets utility easements public property and public ways of the city and utilized in the provision of telecommunications services including digital or analog voice data and video imaging and any other telecommunications services telecommunications provider or provider means any person including its affiliates and subsidiaries other than the city that provides or is applying to provide telecommunications services within the geographic boundaries of the city by utilizing its own telecommunications facilities to provide telecommunications services a person that has transmission lines within upon over or under city streets whether or not that person provides services within the city is included within this definition for the purposes of this chapter telecommunications services or services means any activity for delivering telecommunications by a telecommunications provider within the geographic boundaries of the city that the provider is authorized to provide under federal state and local law except that these terms do not include cable service as defined in the cable communications policy act of 198 as amended by the cable television consumer protection and competition act of 199 47 usc  521 et seq and the telecommunications act of 1996 transmission line means a telecommunications facility that is used solely for the purpose of transmitting signals from one point outside the city to another point outside the city and does not include a line for the purpose of delivering telecommunications services to any person in the city  62398 requirement of citys consent a every telecommunications provider that utilizes a telecommunications facility to provide services within the city must first obtain a city business license every telecommunications provider must also obtain consent or a franchise from the city in accordance with this chapter in order to construct maintain or operate any facilities within on over or under any city street prior to providing any telecommunications service or constructing or utilizing any telecommunications facility the provider must provide a written acceptance of the terms and conditions of this chapter  62398 application process a any telecommunications provider seeking to provide telecommunications service or utilize city streets the applicant shall complete a brief application form approved by the department of public works such application form shall briefly describe the general nature of the service to be provided the type of construction or use of facilities required the name address and telephone number of the person or entity seeking to provide the service and the name address and telephone number of an authorized representative of the person or entity b the applicant shall also provide evidence in a form satisfactory to the city that it has the financial legal and technical qualifications necessary to provide the service for which it seeks a franchise and that all required federal and state certifications have been applied for or granted certification by the south carolina public service commission shall be sufficient evidence of such qualifications c in considering whether to grant consent or a franchise or to impose terms and conditions on the grant of consent or a franchise the city may consider without limitation the following factors 1 the applicants receipt of all required state and federal authorizations  2 the capacity of the streets to accommodate the applicants proposed facilities  3 the damage or disruption if any of public or private facilities improvements or landscaping if a franchise or license is granted  4 the effect on public health safety or welfare if consent or a franchise is granted  5 the availability of alternate routes and locations for the proposed facilities  6 whether the imposition of certain terms and conditions or the failure to grant the requested consent or a franchise would prohibit or have the effect of prohibiting the ability of the applicant to provide any interstate or intrastate telecommunications services  and 7 any other factor relating to whether the grant of consent or a franchise impinges on the citys right to manage its streets d an applicant for consent or a franchise shall submit with its application a fee in the amount of $100000 in partial compensation to the city for processing the application e if the city approves the application the provider shall reimburse the city for any reasonable costs and expenses in excess of the fee specified in subsection d above including attorneys fees incurred by the city to review and evaluate the application and prepare and negotiate a consent agreement or franchise agreement with the provider including the costs of any publication as provided in section 2055  62398 consent agreement or franchise agreement a as a condition of the grant of consent or a franchise the provider shall enter into a consent agreement or franchise agreement with the city b the required agreement shall contain such additional terms and conditions as are not in conflict with the terms of this chapter as may be necessary and appropriate for the particular circumstances of the provider and its use of and impact on city streets c the consent agreement or franchise agreement shall be adopted as an ordinance by the city prior to the initiation of any construction or the delivery of any service d a consent agreement or franchise agreement may be amended from time to time upon agreement of the city and the provider e the telecommunications provider shall pay to the city or on behalf of the city the cost of any publication required by law  62398 construction and maintenance a application prior to beginning construction of any telecommunications facility including any curb cut or pavement cut the applicant shall obtain permission from the department of public works of the city to carry out construction activities in the citys streets and shall comply with all requirements of that department or any other ordinance or code applicable hereto b construction plan prior to beginning construction the applicant shall submit a plan describing the proposed construction the plan shall specify 1 the design of any telecommunications facilities to be constructed or utilized  2 a map showing the precise location of any telecommunications facility to be constructed or utilized and any appurtenant facilities such as poles attachments guy wires and the like  3 the timetable for completion of construction including any phases of construction  4 such other information as will provide the city with pertinent information relating to the construction of the telecommunications facilities including any pertinent information requested by the city c prior authority prior to beginning construction the applicant shall have received all necessary regulatory authority to construct a telecommunications facility or provide telecommunications service from the south carolina public service commission the federal communications commission or other appropriate state or federal agency evidence that it has received such regulatory authority or that such authority is not required shall be filed with the city d standards of construction the method of construction workmanship used and materials utilized in the construction shall conform to all applicable federal state and local statutes rules regulations and ordinances all work shall be performed in a safe thorough and reliable manner using materials of good and durable quality so as not to create a hazard or dangerous condition on the streets if at any time it is determined by the city or any other agency or authority of competent jurisdiction that any telecommunications facility presents a danger to the public health safety or welfare then the telecommunications provider shall at its own cost and expense after reasonable notice from the city promptly correct all such conditions e maintenance and repair any telecommunications facility constructed or utilized pursuant to a consent agreement or franchise agreement shall be maintained and repaired in accordance with the standards and under the terms and conditions set out in the preceding paragraph and such other terms and conditions as shall appear in this chapter or the agreement f minimal disruption construction maintenance and repair of the telecommunications facilities shall be conducted in such a manner as to minimize any interference with or disruption of the citys streets traffic residences businesses and institutions where underground construction is required by subsection i below the provider shall be obligated to use trenchless technology in appropriate circumstances as determined by the citys director of public works g restoration any disturbance of the citys streets shall be repaired and restored by the telecommunications provider at its expense to a condition as good as that prevailing before the work causing such disturbance was commenced if at any time the city determines that any restoration performed by the provider is deficient to the extent that it poses a threat to the safety of the public the city shall have the right to undertake emergency repairs or other protective actions as may in its opinion be necessary and the provider shall reimburse the city for all costs of such repair or other actions if any restoration performed by the telecommunications provider does not comply with the standards established in this section the city may after ten days written notice to the provider perform necessary repairs to bring the restoration up to such standards and the provider shall reimburse the city for all costs of such repair h location of facilities poles and other facilities shall be located to the extent feasible in such a way as to minimize their effect on the visual landscape and on other aesthetic considerations and so as to minimize inconvenience i burial of facilities it is the intent of city council that all utility facilities including all telecommunications facilities be underground in all areas of the city as quickly as is technically and economically feasible all providers who enter into a franchise agreement or consent agreement with the city shall acknowledge that they will be required to place all facilities underground at their own expense upon the occurrence of any of the following 1 immediately in any area of the city where all existing electric telephone and cable television lines are currently underground or where such lines are scheduled to be placed underground within one year 2 within three years after the expiration earlier termination or material amendment of the existing electric franchise granted to the south carolina public service commission santee cooper the santee cooper franchise will expire under its terms on  3 at such time as the city requires all holders of existing telephone electric and cable franchises or consent agreements to place their facilities underground if the city establishes the requirement in a specific area of the city this provision shall apply to all facilities in that area if the city establishes this requirement citywide it shall apply to all providers citywide 4 during the pendency of any litigation which may be brought by a competitor that has the effect of delaying the placement of that competitors facilities underground a provider may elect at its own risk to install above ground facilities within any area subject to the litigation but will be required to place its facilities underground at its own expense upon a final determination of the litigation that upholds the requirement to place the facilities underground in extreme circumstances city council may by ordinance grant permission for the installation of limited aboveground facilities if council finds that underground installation would be technically impractical or cause extreme economic hardship in all cases similarly impacted providers shall be treated similarly nothing herein shall be construed to prohibit or discourage agreements between providers and the city to provide incentives for the placement of facilities underground earlier than herein provided j colocation  sharing of pole space and conduits to the maximum extent feasible a telecommunications provider constructing a new transmission line or other facility or expanding an existing line or facility shall utilize existing pole space or conduit facilities the owner of any existing facility shall to the extent permitted by law and consistent with any pole attachment regulations of the public service commission the federal communications commission or other appropriate agency permit the telecommunications provider to utilize its poles or conduits k movement of facilities a telecommunications provider shall be required to temporarily disconnect or relocate any of its facilities at its own expense when required by the city by reason of traffic conditions  public safety  or the construction installation or repair of any public road highway building park or other public project the provider shall cooperate with any other public utility authorized by the city to provide utility service utilizing the citys streets to the extent any removal or relocation is required for the benefit of any party other than the city the provider may require payment of the actual cost of the removal or relocation by the benefitted party l tree trimming the zoning ordinance of the city provides that an annual permit may be issued to a provider exempting the provider from the provisions of the citys tree protection ordinance but requires that the provider shall nevertheless conform its treetrimming practices to the 1995 ansi a300 standards the provider shall give the city zoning administrator 24hours notice prior to undertaking any tree trimming the zoning administrator may choose to observe any tree trimming performed by a provider and if the required standards are not complied with take all necessary enforcement action the administrator determines to be appropriate pursuant to the zoning ordinance in the event a provider is found to have repeatedly violated the required standards in performing tree trimming the city may also pursue any of the remedies in sections 20517 and 20518  62398 performance bond a prior to the start of construction the provider shall post a performance bond satisfactory to the city in the citys favor to ensure faithful performance of the terms and provisions of the consent agreement or franchise agreement and any approved construction plan filed with the city pursuant to subsection 2056b the bond shall be equivalent to ten percent of the total cost of the construction as provided in the construction plan b in the event the provider fails to comply with this chapter or the franchise agreement or to complete the construction in a safe timely and competent manner after notice and a reasonable opportunity to cure the city may recover jointly and severally from the principal and surety of the bond any damages or loss suffered by the city as a result including the full amount of any compensation indemnification or cost of removal or abandonment of any property of the provider plus a reasonable allowance for attorneys fees up to the full amount of the bond  62398 term of franchise for providers a franchise agreement shall be for a term not exceeding ten years in determining the term of a franchise it is the intent of the city that the term be established so that all telecommunications franchises shall expire on approximately the same date  62398 fees a amount in consideration of the citys grant of authority to utilize the citys streets for the provision of telecommunications services and for other good and valuable consideration the telecommunications provider shall pay a franchise fee to the city in the following amounts 1 a telecommunications provider who provides service to residents businesses or institutions in the city shall pay one percent of its annual gross revenues derived from its provision of telecommunications service in the city payment of this franchise fee is in addition to any business license tax that the provider is required to pay for the privilege of conducting business in the city 2 a telecommunications provider who provides service solely to persons outside the geographic boundaries of the city by utilizing a transmission line shall pay the city a reasonable annual fee based upon an installation fee and a charge per linear foot of transmission line that traverses the citys rightsofway or based upon such other method as the city deems appropriate such fee and the method of payment shall be established in the consent agreement b time of payment all fees due and owing shall be paid on a biannual basis on or before august 15 of each year for the first six months of the calendar year and on or before february 15 of each year for the second six months of the preceding calendar year c late payment in the event that any payment is not actually received by the city on or before the date due under this chapter interest thereon shall accrue from such date until received at the rate of ten percent per annum d calculation of payments all payments made to the city shall be accompanied by a statement certified as true by an appropriate employee of the provider or lessee explaining the basis of the calculation on which the payment was made e payments payments shall be made by certified check to the city of myrtle beach co city finance director po box 246 937 broadwaycity hall myrtle beach south carolina 295782468 or by wire transfer to an account of the city designated in writing by the city finance director f public disclosure the payment of any fee under this section shall be publicly disclosed g audit upon reasonable notice the city shall have the right to inspect the telecommunications providers books and records that are reasonably necessary for the city to determine compliance with this section such records shall not include any records relating to the existence or content of communications of the providers customers which are protected from disclosure by federal or state law a telecommunications provider shall maintain sufficient financial records governing its operation in the city to allow the determination of gross revenues and to otherwise document accurate payment of fees to the extent permitted under the south carolina freedom of information act the city shall maintain the confidentiality of such records h fees not a tax the fees provided in this section are not taxes and are separate from and in addition to any and all federal state local and city taxes as may be levied imposed or due from a telecommunications provider or lessee its customers or subscribers or on account of the lease sale delivery or transmission of telecommunications services  provided that no fee imposed by this section shall be imposed in violation of state or federal law  62398 indemnification a as a condition of the grant of consent or a franchise the telecommunications provider shall agree to indemnify defend and hold harmless the city its officers for renewal to the city no more than 365 and no less than 180 days before expiration of its franchise the applicant shall provide such necessary information to show that it meets the requirements for renewal set out in subsection b below b in considering whether to grant a renewal request the city shall consider whether the telecommunications provider 1 has complied with the terms of this chapter and its consent agreement or franchise agreement  2 has promptly cured any violation of this chapter or breach of its consent agreement or franchise agreement  3 has fully and promptly paid any franchise fees or other compensation required by the city and any taxes imposed by the state or the city  4 agrees to meet such additional requirement as may be imposed by the city in a competitively neutral and nondiscriminatory way  and 5 has cooperated with the city in carrying out the terms and conditions of this chapter and the franchise or license agreement and has provided such pertinent information as the city has requested throughout the term of the agreement the city shall also consider any other matter that is relevant to the renewal of the franchise or license c the city reserves the right to refuse to renew any franchise for any reason provided that the city shall comply with of the telecommunications act of 1996 d if it chooses not to renew the consent agreement or franchise agreement the city shall state its reasons in writing and provide the telecommunications provider with a copy  62398 removal a within 30 days following written notice from the city any telecommunications provider or other person that owns controls or maintains any unauthorized telecommunications facility or related appurtenances on in under or above the streets shall at its own expense remove such facilities and appurtenances from the streets b a telecommunications facility is unauthorized if the franchise of the applicable telecommunications provider has expired or has never been obtained if the facility has been abandoned or if the construction of the facility was not in compliance with this chapter and the consent agreement or franchise agreement a utility pole shall be deemed to be abandoned whenever all wires lines cables and other facilities have been removed from the pole for a period of 30 days or more c any abandoned utility pole which is not removed by the telecommunications provider as provided in this section may after ten days written notice be removed by the city in the event of such removal by the city the telecommunications provider shall pay the city for all costs incurred by the city to have the pole removed  62398 transfer  transfer of control a any person granted a consent agreement or a franchise agreement pursuant to this chapter grantee shall not sell transfer lease assign sublet or dispose of in whole or in part either by forced or by involuntary sale or by ordinary sale consolidation merger or otherwise the consent or franchise agreement or any of the rights or privileges granted thereunder without the prior consent of the city council which consent shall not be unreasonably withheld or delayed evidence provided to the city of approval by the state public service commission shall be acceptable for compliance with this section b a grantee who seeks to take any of the actions specified in subsection a above shall notify the city at least 90 days in advance of such anticipated action in addition to providing notice of the proposed action grantee and the proposed transferee lessee assignee subletee purchaser or other entity transferee shall also provide the following information at the time of such notice 1 complete information setting forth the nature terms and condition of the proposed transaction  and 2 information evidencing the transferees legal technical and financial qualifications within 20 days of a request by the city the grantee and transferee shall also provide such other information pertinent to the proposed transaction as may be required by the city c within 60 days of receiving all the information it has requested the city shall take action on the proposed transaction if the city disapproves the proposed transaction it shall state its reasons in a resolution of the city council if the city approves the proposed transaction but with conditions it shall likewise state the conditions in a resolution of the city council d failure to obtain the approval of the city council as required by this section may be deemed a forfeiture of the applicable franchise by the city council  62398 existing telecommunications providers a a telecommunications provider delivering service within or without the geographic limits of the city as of the effective date of this chapter who previously has been awarded a franchise may continue to operate according to the terms of the franchise it has been awarded b any telecommunications provider who as of the effective date of this chapter is delivering service without a franchise shall submit an application pursuant to section 2054 of this chapter within 90 days of the effective date the provider shall also submit a written statement indicating that it accepts the terms and conditions of this chapter while its application is pending and that it shall pay all appropriate fees retroactive to the effective date  62398 forfeiture a if in the citys judgment a telecommunications provider is or may be in violation or breach of any material term or condition of this chapter or consent or franchise agreement pursuant hereto the city shall notify the provider of the suspected violation or breach upon notification the provider shall supply to the city within 30 days all information and documentation the city requests with respect to the suspected violation or breach and shall make such statement to the city as it wishes in an effort to explain or mitigate the violation or breach b if the city is not satisfied with the information documentation and explanation of the provider it may make a finding of a breach or violation and notify the provider of such finding thereafter the provider shall have a reasonable period of time the cure period as determined by the city to take such steps as are necessary to cure the violation or breach c if at the conclusion of the cure period the city determines that there remains a breach or violation of this chapter or consent or franchise agreement pursuant hereto the city shall schedule a hearing before the city council or a duly authorized committee or representative of the council for the purpose of making a final determination as to whether a violation or breach exists at the hearing the provider representatives of the city and the public may present evidence relevant to the alleged violation or breach d at the conclusion of the hearing or within 14 days thereafter the city council shall takes such steps as it deems appropriate including one or more of the following 1 pursuing any of the remedies available to it as provided in section 20517  2 ordering the provider to take such steps as are necessary to cure the violation or breach on pain of forfeiture  3 declaring a forfeiture of the consent or franchise and ordering the provider to take such steps as are necessary to remove its telecommunications facilities from the citys streets e if the provider is dissatisfied with the decision of the city it may seek relief in the circuit court in and for horry county  62398 enforcement  penalties a a violation of any provision of this chapter shall be a misdemeanor subject to a penalty within the jurisdictional limits of a municipal court in the state b the city may seek injunctive relief or abatement orders in a court of competent jurisdiction to enforce the provisions of this chapter c the city may pursue any of the remedies in this chapter separately or in conjunction with one another  62398 general provisions a captions the captions to sections throughout this chapter are intended solely to facilitate reading and shall not affect the meaning or interpretation of this chapter b no recourse against the city without limiting such immunities as the city or any other person may have under applicable law a telecommunications provider awarded consent or a franchise under this chapter shall have no recourse whatsoever against the city or its officials members boards commissions agents or employees for any loss cost expense liability or damage arising out of any action undertaken or not undertaken pursuant to any provision or requirement of this chapter or because of the enforcement of this chapter or the citys exercise of its authority pursuant to this chapter or other applicable law unless such loss is a direct consequence of the failure or refusal of the city to perform its agreement hereunder or unless such recourse is expressly authorized by statute this chapter or other ordinance c force majeure in the event a telecommunications providers performance of any of the terms conditions obligations or requirements of this chapter is prevented or impaired due to any cause beyond its reasonable control such inability to perform shall be deemed to be excused for the period of such inability and no penalties or sanctions shall be imposed as a result thereof provided that the provider has notified the city in writing within ten days of its discovery of the occurrence of such an event such causes beyond the providers reasonable control shall include but shall not be limited to acts of god civil emergencies and labor unrest or strikes d nonwaiver of remedies the failure of the city to take any action to enforce any violation or breach of this chapter shall not be deemed a waiver of its right to subsequently enforce any identical or similar violation or breach e severability if any portion of this franchise is declared invalid by any court agency commission legislative body or other authority of competent jurisdiction such portion shall be deemed a separate distinct and independent portion and such declaration shall not affect the validity of the remaining portions hereof which remaining portions shall continue in force and effect f notices and filings all notices required by this chapter to be provided to the city shall be provided in writing to the city clerk all filings shall be made with the city clerk unless otherwise provided in this chapter  62398 utilities footnotes  1  cross reference buildings and building regulations ch 6  planning and development and environmental control scdhec certified tester after installation and before use by the customer and each device shall be tested at least once annually by a scdheccertified inspector the customer shall provide the city with a written report of the inspection and testing results as prepared by the scdheccertified tester making the inspection and test all costs associated with inspection and from the date of billing these bills shall include both the water and sewer service charge when applicable the sewer charge is based on water consumption b if the monthly bill is not paid on or before the due date the following occurs if any bill remains unpaid ten days after the due date all services to the customer shall be forthwith discontinued and remain discontinued until the full obligation including the past due bill with penalty the current service charge and a meter reinstallation fee if the meter has been removed the fee for the meter reinstallation shall be set by the director of finance if any bill remains unpaid ten days after the discontinuance of service the meter will be subject to removal by the city prior to the removal of the meter written notice shall be mailed to the customer and in the case of rental property written notice shall also be mailed to the property owner or their designated agent if the property owners name is not on file the property owners notice will be mailed to the service address a customer has the right to appeal a water and or sewer bill to the director of finance the director of finance will determine any adjustment and the decision of the director of finance is final c if a water meter shall be removed for nonpayment of a bill or removed at the request of the customer a fee based on direct and indirect labor direct material and overhead shall be assessed for reinstallation of the meter for that property regardless of the reason the meter was removed at the time of reinstallation the customer shall be required to comply with all the existing city policies relating to the provision of water andor sewer that would apply if service were being provided to the property for the first time d no water or sewer service shall be furnished or rendered free of charge to any person corporation or other legal entity except for internal city operations e if a metering device fails to operate during any billing period or portion thereof the city shall render a bill for the same amount of water andor sewer billed to that account during the same period of the previous year unless satisfactory documentation for less usage can be provided if a failure occurs during the first year of the account history a reasonable bill based on available historical account information will be rendered f if a balance remains on a utility account after it has been closed the city has the right pursuant to the south carolina setoff debt collection act to collect any sum due and owed by the customer of the customers state income tax years the sewage contributions of users the total costs of operation and maintenance of the sewerage facilities and the user charge system the city shall revise the user charge if necessary to accomplish the following 1 maintain the proportionate distribution of operation and maintenance costs among users as provided in this section 2 generate sufficient revenue to pay the total operation and maintenance costs necessary for the proper operation and maintenance of the sewerage facilities e all flow to the sewerage facilities not directly attributable to the users ie infiltrationinflow specifically indicates otherwise the meaning of certain terms and phrases used in this article shall be as follows construction means new building or addition as well as remodeling or renovating existing buildings which includes the installation or replacement of toilets toilet reservoirs etc faucet means any inside fixture or device for drawing water from a pipe within the jurisdiction of the city of myrtle beach shower means any water apparatus or device that provides a shower or booth in which public water is used to shower the body toilet means any waste disposal fixture or system used for discharging human wastes to the public sewer system water means all water delivered conveyed or distributed by means of the city public water system watersaving devices means such fixtures or measures or apparatus that restrict the flow or use of water provided by the public water system such devices may include but are not limited to the following 1 plastic dams means devices that dam off a portion of a toilet reservoir and are adjusted to maintain a lower water level in the toilet reservoir 2 improved float assemblies means devices that are installed in toilet reservoirs that are adjusted to maintain a lower water level in the toilet reservoir 3 faucet aerators means devices within the faucet that mix water with air and provide an even flow to reduce the amount of water flowing from a faucet 4 spray taps means devices used in lavatory sinks and wash basins that cause water to be sprayed from the tap rather than issuing forth a single stream 5 flowcontrol devices means devices used in shower heads and faucets that limit or restrict the amount of flow of water used 6 watersaving toilets means toilets that contain a smaller water reservoir than that of a conventional toilet  cross reference definitions and rules of construction generally  12 use of watersaving devices required all construction of any type which connects to the public water system shall not be initiated or provided with service by the city unless the owner has complied fully with the prescribed water conservation measures  watersaving devices for construction all interior plumbing for construction shall meet the following minimum design criteria 1 toilets urinals and associated flush valves shall not use more than 312 gallons per flush 2 shower heads shall contain inserts valves devices or orifices that restrict flow to a maximum of approximately three gallons per minute at 60 pounds per square inch psi or such other watersaving devices available that may be approved by the city 3 kitchen and lavatory faucets shall have aerators or laminar flow devices together with flowcontrol inserts valves devices or orifices that restrict flow to a maximum of approximately two gallons per minute at 60 psi or such other available watersaving devices may be approved by the city  watersaving measures for new developments all new parks median strips landscaped public areas and landscaped areas surrounding condominiums townhouses apartments industrial parks and shopping centers planning to install an irrigation system shall have a wellbalanced automatic irrigation system designed by an engineer or other certified person approved by the city and shall be operated by electrical time controller stations set for early morning irrigation between  am and  am landscaping covering claytype soils and sloped areas shall be equipped with lowoutput sprinkler heads permitting a slow water application rate the city may upon the written request of an applicant waive any part or all of the requirements of this section if it finds that the areas to be landscaped are too small or do not otherwise justify the automatic irrigation system and other measures herein referenced it is recommended where irrigation systems are designed that first consideration be given to an onsite shallow well water source system if a shallow well water source is to be used in no case shall such system be interconnected with the citys public system upon the submission of substantial documentation that an onsite water source system cannot be employed then consideration will be given to the approval of the herein referenced provisions  watersaving technology the city code enforcement division shall periodically publish and have on file for public review an uptodate list of watersaving fixtures devices or measures that address the intent of this article  watersaving devices for existing users for each water service customer the city may require the use of watersaving devices which may include but not necessarily be limited to the following 1 plastic dams or improved float assemblies for reducing toilet flush water requirements  2 a flowcontrol device restrictor for reducing shower flow rates  3 a dye tablet or tablets for determining if a toilet tank leaks  4 other pertinent conservation measures  leaks leaks occurring in any plumbing system or part thereof which is served water from the city water system shall be repaired within five days after such leak is detected  exceptions the provisions of this article shall not apply to fixtures or devices which have been ordered by or are in the inventory of contractors suppliers or developers on or before  nor shall they apply to fixtures such as safety showers and aspirator faucets which in order to perform a specialized function cannot meet the standards herein specified contractors suppliers andor developers shall provide such evidence as invoices purchase orders and bills of lading dated prior to  if requested by the city  enforcement procedure and penalties a any person found to be violating any provision of this article shall be served by the city with written notice stating the nature of the violation and providing a reasonable time limit for the satisfactory correction thereof the offender shall within the period of time stated in such notice permanently cease all violations and take corrective action the city reserves the right to refuse water services to the offenders b any person who shall continue any violation beyond the time limit provided for in subsection a shall be guilty of a misdemeanor each day in which any such violation shall continue shall be deemed a separate offense c any person who knowingly makes any false statement representation or certification in any application record report plan or other document filed or required to be maintained pursuant to this article or who falsifies tampers with or knowingly renders the water conservation devices inoperable shall upon conviction be punished in accordance with section 19 d in addition to the aforesaid wherever a person violates any provision of this article or fails to comply with any order of the city the city may apply to the court of the state for the issuance of an injunction restraining the person violating the article or failing to comply with the order basis requires flush valves if flush valves are not required or preferred then install low flush toilets  secs 21612175  reserved article iv  industrial pretreatment program introduction a the general pretreatment regulations for existing and new sources of pollution 40 cfr 403 as promulgated by the us environmental protection agency epa in june 197 outlines the regulations for a pretreatment program the epa delegated to the state department of health and environmental control the administration and enforcement authority for the state pretreatment program b the objectives of the pretreatment program are to 1 prevent the introduction of pollutants into publicly owned treatment works potw which will interfere with plant operations andor the disposal or use of municipal sludge 2 prevent the introduction of pollutants into a potw which will pass treatment works or be incompatible with the potw 3 improve opportunities to recycle and reclaim wastewater and sludges 4 enforce applicable epa categorical standards 5 provide for equitable distribution of the cost for treatment of waste discharged to the potw c the state pretreatment program is divided into two phases phase i deals primarily with an evaluation of the existing situation at a potw phase ia consists of surveying the nondomestic dischargers and evaluating the type volume and strength of the discharged waste to the potw phases ia and ib of the pretreatment program for the city was submitted in june 1989 to the state department of health and environmental control the state department of health and environmental control advised that a complete pretreatment program would be required for the city potw d this report addressed the development of the pretreatment program that will be implemented by the city and fulfills phase ii of the state pretreatment program phase ii concerns the organization staffing funding and adoption of ordinances that are needed to implement the pretreatment program e composite sampling was conducted on the influent and effluent of the city wastewater treatment facility and one major industrial discharger no excessive amounts of substances could be found in the plant influent that would be detrimental to treatment plant performance historically the wastewater treatment facility is well within the npdes permit limits for bod and tss very low concentrations of metals were present in both the waste treatment plant influent and effluent f sampling of the major dischargers to the system was undertaken to determine the characteristics of their discharges the results of the sample analyses are available for review at the city engineering and public services department  12892 definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall in proportion to flow if continuous flow measurement is not used to composite in proportion to flow the following method will be used take an instantaneous flow measurement each time a grab sample is collected at the end of the sampling period sum the instantaneous flow measurements to obtain a total flow to determine the partial amount percentage of each grab sample to be combined to obtain the composite sample 3 a combination of not less than eight influent or effluent grab samples of equal volume but at variable time intervals that are inversely proportional to the volume of the flow that is the time interval between aliquots is reduced as the volume of flow increases 4 a combination of not less than eight influent or effluent grab samples or constant equal volume collected at regular equal time intervals over a specified period of time while being properly preserved continuous flow or the sum of instantaneous flows measured and averaged for the specified compositing time period
