a new art ii as set out herein the former art ii pertained to similar subject matter and derived from adopted  purpose of article the purpose of this chapter is to regulate and control the operation of taxicabs for hire in the city in order to ensure an adequate and regular level of service to the public and to preserve the health and welfare of the citizens and visitors to the city and to protect their property  definitions unless it appears from the context that a different meaning is intended the following words and phrases when used in this chapter shall have the meanings ascribed to them by this section association means any group of two or more certificateholders operating taxicabs not under common ownership but under unified control and using one common dispatch center certificate means the certificate of public convenience and necessity authorized by the city to grant permission to operate a taxicab in the city subject to such regulations as may be enacted from time to time certificate holder means any individual association partnership company corporation or other organization that has been granted a certificate of public convenience and necessity as provided in this chapter city means the city of myrtle beach its officials appointees and employees city manager means the city manager of the city of myrtle beach and any agents duly appointed by the city manager driver means the person actually driving the taxicab forhire permit means the chauffeurs permit as described in this chapter police chief means the chief of police of the city of myrtle beach and any agents duly appointed by the chief of police taxicab means any motor vehicle equipped with a taximeter top light and proper lettering all as required in this article having a seating capacity of not more than fifteen passengers including the driver and not operating on a regular route or between terminals used in the transportation of passengers for hire or for compensation taxicab business means the business of transporting passengers for compensation by taxicab taxi hearing panel or hearing panel means a five person panel appointed by the manager to receive applications for certificates and to hear appeals regarding suspension and revocation no member of the police department can be appointed taxicab service means and includes the operation of any taxicab upon any street or highway on call or on demand accepting or soliciting passengers indiscriminately for transportation between such points along streets or highways as may be directed by the passenger or passengers so being transported taximeter means a mechanical instrument or device by which the charge for hire of a taxicab is mechanically calculated either for distance traveled or for waiting time or both and upon which such charge shall be indicated by means of figures vehicleowner means any person association partnership corporation or other organization having title to or leasing any taxicab as herein defined    certificate of public convenience and necessity a required it shall be unlawful to engage in the taxicab business unless a certificate of public convenience city managers recommendations the hearing may be continued by motion in its sole discretion from time to time and from place to place the hearing panel shall also consider the following relevant factors in making its determination 1 the adequacy of existing taxicab service and other forms of transportation for passengers already in existence 2 the probable permanence and quality of the the experience of the applicant in taxicab operations as an owner or manager or as a taxicab driver 6 the degree to which the approval of an application will impact on the level of healthy competition within the taxicab industry 7 the impact on public facilities likely if the new taxicabs are added c at the hearing before the hearing panel the applicant shall have the right to present his case in person or by a representative of his choice d the hearing panel shall consider the case record as well as statements offered by any interested party the hearing need not be conducted according to technical rules relating to evidence and witnesses any relevant evidence may be admitted if it is the sort of evidence on which responsible persons are accustomed to rely in the conduct of serious affairs regardless of the existence of any common law or statutory rule that might make improper the admission of such evidence in civil actions e after the public hearing the hearing panel may authorize certificates for the number of vehicles applied for for a lesser number than that applied for or the manager may deny issuance of any certificate the applicant shall be notified of the decision by certified mail to the address provide on the application  denial of certificate  appeal a the hearing panel may deny an application for a certificate for any of the following reasons 1 whenever in sole judgment based on facts and circumstances a determination has is reached that issuance of the certificate would not be in the best interest of the public or that any increase in the number of authorized taxicabs would be detrimental to the public welfare 2 whenever an applicant has submitted incomplete or false information on an application for a certificate 3 whenever it is determined that an applicant or any principal in the applicants company or any officer or manager within the company a has been convicted or pleaded guilty or nolo contendere to the violation of any law involving a sex offense soliciting for prostitution or the manufacturing or distribution of any drug classified as a controlled substance  or b has been convicted or pleaded guilty or nolo contendere to the violation of any law involving illegal drugs or controlled substances other than those offenses listed in a above gambling or a crime involving moral turpitude in the five years preceding the application  or c is on parole or probation for a criminal offense b a denial by the hearing panel may be appealed to city council with 15 days of denial with a delivery of a notice of appeal to the city manager the city council shall convene for a de novo review within 30 days of receipt of the notice of appeal the council shall have the authority to uphold reverse or modify the decision of the hearing panel based on its interpretation of the facts and applicable sections of this article the council shall announce its decision before the conclusion of the hearing and provide a written decision to the parties within ten days thereafter provided however the councils decision shall be effective immediately when the decision is announced proceedings before the panel and the council shall be recorded on audiotape either party may have the proceedings stenographically recorded at its own expense the decision of the council shall be final to the extent an appeal is permitted under law an adverse decision by the city council may be appealed to the circuit court in and for horry county by filing with the clerk of such court a petition in writing setting forth plainly fully and distinctly wherein such decision is contrary to law such appeal shall be filed within 30 days after the decision of the council is announced the filing of such appeal does not stay revoked 1 if the transfer of a certificate is proposed to be to an individual or business entity that has one or more valid certificates and is currently operating one or more taxicabs in full compliance with this article the city manager may approve the transfer and issue a new certificate to the transferee the transferee will be required to pay a fee equal to the annual renewal fee for certificates 2 if the transfer of a certificate is proposed to be to an individual or business entity that does not currently hold a certificate the transferee shall notify the city manager in writing and provide all of the information required in section 2323b as if making application for a new certificate within 15 days of receipt the manager shall make his recommendation to the hearing panel within 30 days of the managers recommendation the hearing panel shall convene and make its determination the fee for issuance of an original certificate will be required to be paid by the transferee the request to approve a transfer shall then be processed for approval in the same manner as an application for an original certificate with the exception that it may be submitted and processed at any time without regard to the provision of section 2323 e a certificate holder may substitute a vehicle for the taxicab authorized by a certificate by surrendering the existing certificate and the taxicab decal from the old taxicab and requesting a new certificate for the vehicle to be substituted upon a determination by the police chief that the certificate holder is in full compliance with the provisions of this article and that the vehicle to be substituted qualifies for issuance of a taxicab decal a new certificate and decal will be issued    revocation or suspension of certificates  appeal a the chief of police or his designee may suspend certificates of public convenience and necessity for such period of time as is necessary for the correction of a violation any failure of duty or obligation arising under this chapter b the police chief or his designee shall revoke all of the certificates held by any individual or entity whenever the chief discovers reliable information which was not available to city manager when manager approved the issuance of the certificates if such information would have provided grounds for denial of the application by city manager pursuant to the provisions of this chapter c the police chief or his designee shall revoke all of the certificates held by an individual or entity whenever the chief discovers that subsequent to the issuance of the certificates events have occurred which would provide grounds to deny a future application for a permit pursuant to the provisions of section 23253 d the police chief or his designee shall revoke certificates in violation of section 2341 e a suspension or revocation of any certificate decal or chauffeurs permit by the chief of police or designee pursuant to the provisions of this article is effective immediately but is subject to appeal when the police find a violation of the provisions of this chapter the certificate may be suspended until such time as the violation is corrected provided however the application and fixed time limits of sections 2329 2339 and 2341 shall remain in effect or the police chief or his designee may revoke as provided by law such suspension or revocation shall be effective immediately and shall be reduced to writing but is subject to appeal to appeal the certificate holder shall submit to the police chief or his designee in writing a notice of appeal and the reason why the suspension or revocation is in error a fiveperson panel appointed by the city manager shall conduct the scheduled hearing within 15 calendar days of the citys receipt of the notice of appeal the city manager shall also designate one of his appointees to act as chairperson at the hearing the panel shall accept any relevant documents or statements from the holder and from the police chief or his designee the panel shall have the authority to uphold reverse or modify the decision of the police chief or designee based on its interpretation of the facts and applicable sections of this article the decision of the panel shall be approved by a majority of the panel members the panel shall announce its decision before the conclusion of the hearing and provide a written decision to the parties within ten days thereafter the panels decision shall be effective immediately when the decision is announced proceedings before the panel shall be recorded on audiotape either party may have the proceedings stenographically recorded at its own expense the decision of the panel shall be final to the extent an appeal is permitted under law an adverse decision by the hearing panel may be appealed to the circuit court in and for horry county by filing with the clerk of such court a petition in writing setting forth plainly fully and distinctly wherein such decision is contrary to law such appeal shall be filed within 30 days after the decision of the hearing panel is announced the filing of such appeal does not stay the implementation of the panels decision    individual taxicab decal a required 1 for each taxicab covered by certificate a taxicab decal shall be issued in a form prescribed by the police chief this decal is the property of the city is not transferable and must be returned to the city immediately when demanded by the police chief or as may be required elsewhere herein 2 it shall be unlawful to operate a taxicab in the city without the decal conspicuously displayed in a manner prescribed by the police chief b insurance no taxicab decal shall be issued for the operation of a vehicle as a taxicab in the city until the vehicle owner shall have filed with the city proof of insurance issued in the name of the certificate holder acceptable to the city indemnifying the public against personal injury and property damage which may be caused by operation of the vehicle as a taxicab the limits of liability shall be at least those required by state law insurance certificates provided to the city shall provide a minimum required it shall be unlawful for any person operating a taxicab for hire in the city to pick up any passenger for transport to any destination either within or outside the city unless he or she shall have obtained a city chauffeurs permit in addition to any motor vehicle operators licenses required by the state b application for permit 1 application for the permit shall be made in person to the agent of agents prescribed by the city 2 application for a permit shall be made upon forms provided by the city the applicant shall provide information regarding the following a pertinent personal data b traffic record excluding parking citations for ten years previous to the date of the application c criminal record d prior driving experience 3 the applicant shall permit the city to make a record of hisher fingerprints 4 when an application has been denied the applicant may not reapply for a permit for 30 days from the date of denial c investigation of applicant the police chief shall have an investigation made of the facts stated in an application for a permit and other relevant data except for information which by law may not be released the file shall be available to the applicant or his agent upon written authorization of the applicant d issuance of permit 1 if the police chief finds that the applicant is duly qualified and of good moral character he shall issue a taxicab drivers permit to the applicant 2 the police chief may refuse to issue a permit to an applicant for any of the following reasons a from any state within the last two years of application a or similar driving offense as recognized by another state  within south carolina an accumulation of eight points within the past 18 months based upon the following state of south carolina assessment required a information to be provided to police department by certificateholders every certificateholder shall maintain on file with an agent designated by the police chief his name his companys name business address garage address all business telephone numbers listed in his and his companys name and names of all drivers their license numbers and addresses the names and addresses of all vehicle owners the make and meter number of taximeters in each vehicle and shall within 48 hours after any change in connection therewith report such change b drivers daily manifest every driver shall maintain a daily manifest upon which are recorded the time the taxicab began operation and stopped operation on the street the taxicab number and drivers name all trips made each day showing time and place of origin and destination of each trip the number of passengers and amount of fare this information shall be recorded at the end of each trip in addition the driver shall record on each manifest the meter register readings at the beginning and end of each tour of duty for total miles paid miles trips units extra passengers as well as the odometer readings all such completed manifests shall be returned to the certificateholder by the driver at the conclusion of his tour of duty if the driver changes taxicabs during his tour of duty he shall maintain a separate manifest for that portion of the tour of duty in which another vehicle is used the forms for such records shall be furnished to the driver by the certificateholder and shall be subject to the approval of the police chief it shall be unlawful to maintain an incomplete manifest every certificateholder shall retain and preserve all drivers manifests in a safe place for at least 36 months and the same shall be made available upon demand for inspection by an agent of the police chief c lost articles any article found in a taxicab shall be noted on the drivers manifest and be delivered immediately to the police department unless it can be returned to its rightful owner d accident reports as required by section 2337  taximeters a charges by taximeter no person owning operating or controlling any taxicab upon the streets of the city shall charge for the use of such taxicab to exceed the current rates to be determined by the taximeter these rates shall be set from time to time by the city manager and a schedule of such fees is on file in the city clerks office b taximeter required  definition  specifications every taxicab shall have affixed thereto and must use a taximeter of a size and design approved by the police department and conform substantially to the following specifications 1 a taximeter is a mechanical instrument or device by which the charge for hire of a taxicab is mechanically calculated either for distance traveled or for waiting time or both and upon which such charge shall be indicated by means of legible figures which are electrically lighted each time the taximeter flag is thrown from nonearning to earning position 2 such taximeters must register upon visual counters the following items a total miles  b paid miles  3 each taximeter must have a deadclock c taximeter flag the taximeter flag shall not be changed to vacant position until the fare is paid d inspection and sealing required  retesting upon change from one taxicab to another no person shall drive a taxicab to which is attached a taximeter that has not been inspected and approved by the police department the pinion gear shall be sealed so that it cannot be removed or changed without breaking or otherwise damaging the seal it shall be unlawful to change the gears operating the taximeter remove the gear seal or change a taximeter from one taxicab to another unless the taximeter is inspected retested and approved by the police department prior to use e unlawful to operate without it shall be unlawful for any taxicab to be operated for public hire unless it is equipped with a taximeter which must be used as provided in this section  taxicab stands the city manager may designate taxicab stands on the public rightofway at which taxicabs may park and from which they may solicit fares in the city such stands so designated and none other on the public rightofway may be used for parking and soliciting fares the police department shall supervise and regulate such stands  display of fares the prices which will be charged for carrying passengers and baggage in a taxicab shall be prominently displayed in each taxicab in a location clearly visible to the passengers    fares the schedule of maximum rates to be charged for the use of any taxicab within the city shall read as follows 1 for the first oneeighth mile  $150 2 for each additional oneeighth mile  035 3 for each 55 seconds of waiting  035 4 passengers in excess of one person per trip above the age of 15  100    81208 disputes all disputes as to fares shall be resolved by the police department within 24 hours at the police department and both passenger and driver shall comply with such resolution  conduct no driver of a taxicab shall 1 permit more persons to ride in the front seat of any taxicab than the number of seat belts installed in the front seat 2 deceive or attempt to deceive any passenger who may ride in his taxicab or who may desire to ride in such taxicab as to his destination or the rate of fare to be charged or shall convey any passenger or cause him to be conveyed to a place other than directed by him and in no event shall any operator take a longer route to the destination than necessary unless so requested by the passenger or passengers 3 fail to comply with all reasonable and lawful requests of the passenger or passengers as to the speed of travel and the route to be taken 4 have in his possession a lighted cigarette cigar or pipe while any passenger is being carried therein 5 solicit passengers while taxicab is standing or in motion on any public street or other location provided that nothing herein shall be held to prohibit a driver from alighting to the street or sidewalk for the purpose of assisting passengers into or out of the taxicab 6 solicit passengers by any sign or in any manner annoy any person or obstruct the movement of any person or follow any person for the purpose of soliciting patronage 7 receive or discharge passengers in the roadway but shall pull up to the righthand sidewalk or in the absence of a sidewalk to the extreme righthand side of the road and there receive or discharge passengers 8 cruise in search of passengers at any time 9 solicit patronage of persons assembled at the terminal of any other common carrier nor at any intermediate points along any established route of such carrier when such persons have assembled for the purpose of using the service of the common carrier nothing herein contained shall be construed to prohibit or interfere with response to any call for a taxicab made by signal from a pedestrian 10 permit more persons to be carried in a taxicab in the city at any one time than the seating capacity of the taxicab including the driver children in arms exempted 11 refuse or neglect to convey any orderly person upon request unless previously engaged or unable or forbidden by the provisions of this article to do so  engaging cab with fraudulent intent it shall be unlawful for any person in the city to engage or use any taxicab not intending at the time when such taxicab is engaged to pay the legal fare with the intent to defraud the owner or driver of such taxicab of such fare  reporting accidents all traffic accidents involving any taxicab covered by this chapter resulting in any damage or injury to any person real property or personal property no matter how slight and regardless of whether it is investigated by a police agency or not must be reported to the police department in writing by the certificate holder within 24 hours from the time of occurrence this report shall provide the name of the driver his taxi permit number complete vehicle registration information on the taxicab involved as well as the taxi number it will also include the date time and location of the accident and a brief summary of the details of the accident damage to the taxicab will be listed on the report  repair of damage  time limit any dents nicks scratches or other damage resulting from a traffic accident which does not require that the taxicab be removed immediately from service for repairs will be repaired within but no later than 45 days from the date of the accident or the vehicles taxicab decal will be removed and the vehicle removed from service until such time as the damage has been repaired  equipment  appearance construction and maintenance a requirements in addition to equipment required of motor vehicles by the laws of south carolina 1976 as amended every taxicab certified under this chapter 1 shall be equipped with a frame or holder for the proper display of the chauffeurs permit which shall face the passengers and be so located as to be at all times in plain view of such passengers the card frame or holder and the manner and location where it is mounted shall be subject to approval of the police chief 2 shall be equipped with a heater and air conditioner sufficient to heat and cool the interior of the taxicab adequately 3 shall not be equipped with shades or curtains which can be manipulated in such a way as to shield the occupants or the driver from observation or obstruct the drivers view using the rearview mirror no windows in the taxicab shall be tinted to the extent that the driver and all passengers cannot be easily seen from outside the taxicab 4 shall be a motor vehicle designed and manufactured to have a seating capacity of not more than fifteen passengers including the driver 5 shall be equipped with approved safety nonshatterable glass in the windshield and all windows the center partition if any between the drivers compartment and the passenger compartment shall be of this type glass or plastic 6 shall be equipped with a standard speedometer properly installed maintained in good working order and exposed to view no taxicab shall be operated in taxicab service while such speedometer is out of repair or disconnected 7 shall not be equipped with any other lights or signal device except as allowed by the laws of south carolina 1976 as amended or approved by the police chief 8 shall be equipped with a taximeter as prescribed by this chapter 9 shall be kept in a clean and sanitary condition and shall be swept and dusted at least once each day that it is in service at least once every seven days the exterior shall be washed and the interior shall be cleansed thoroughly 10 with the exception of a kick strip not exceeding seven inches in height at the bottom of doors no upholstery covering or interior lining below the windows shall be permitted in any taxicab unless it shall be of leather or similar nonabsorbent washable material the rear cushion shall be removable no floor covering or mat shall be permitted in any licensed taxicab unless it shall be made of rubber leather or metal chain or a similar nonabsorbent washable material provided however that if absorbent floor covering is installed as original equipment in the taxicab it may be retained but must be fully covered with nonabsorbent removable and washable mats variations of this provision will be permitted where strict compliance is impossible because of scarcity of materials 11 every taxicab shall be of good substantial appearance and be so constructed and maintained as to provide for the safety of the public continuous and satisfactory operation and operation at minimum noise and vibration every taxicab shall be structurally sound as to all its parts shall not have broken or cracked fenders or glass and shall be painted to give reasonable protection to all painted surfaces from structural deterioration all marks of identification on taxicabs shall be permanent and clearly legible at all times 12 reserved 13 reserved 14 after  shall not have any sign lettering or message affixed or attached in any way except as required or authorized in subsection b herein b color scheme and required lettering on taxicab 1 all certificate holders shall adopt a separate color scheme for painting their taxicabs which is distinct from that of any other certificate holder all taxicabs of each certificate holder shall be of the same color scheme  provided however that an association including two or more certificate holders shall adopt one uniform color scheme for all taxicabs operated under the control of the association 2 the name of the certificate holder or association taxicab number and telephone number shall be displayed with permanent lettering on both sides and rear of each cab with letters and numbers at least four inches high 3 lettering or numbers shall not be acceptable which are on a sheet of metal or other material which in turn can be removed or detached 4 if a taxicab is owned by a person other than the business entity whose name appears on the taxicab the name of the owner shall be painted in permanent lettering on both sides of the taxicab in letters one and onehalf inches high and located below the name of the entity 5 the taxicab numbers on the side and rear of each taxicab will be assigned at the time the certificate for the taxicab is issued will be recorded on the certificate and will be affixed to the taxicab by the citys inspector no two taxicabs authorized to operate within the city shall have the same taxicab number the number of the taxicab operated pursuant to a certificate shall not be changed unless a new certificate is issued 6 adhesive stickers or vinyl clings showing methods of payment american flags or the message thank you for visiting are permitted as long as the massing or placement of stickers or vinyl clings shall not act a visual barrier      inspection of taxicabs  procedure when taxicab is found in unsafe unfit or unclean condition each taxicab for which a certificate has been issued shall be inspected by an agent prescribed by the police department at least once each calendar year in addition to the annual inspections the police department shall each year randomly select and inspect without notice no less than 20 percent of the taxicabs for which decals have been issued 1 unsafe vehicles if any taxicab is found to be in unsafe condition the taxicab decal shall be immediately removed from the vehicle and the certificateholder shall be notified of the nature of the defect and that the taxicab shall not be operated until such condition has been remedied the certificate holder shall be provided 30 days to have the unsafe condition corrected or to substitute another acceptable vehicle for the vehicle which was found to be unsafe if the certificate holder fails to correct the unsafe condition or to substitute a vehicle which passes inspection within the 30day period the certificate shall be revoked 2 unclean or unfit taxicabs if the taxicab is found to be unclean or unfit but otherwise in safe condition the agent shall give the taxicab owner and driver a reasonable time not to exceed 72 hours to remedy the condition after which the agent shall reinspect the taxicab if the vehicle does not pass the reinspection the decal shall be removed and the taxicab shall not be used as a taxicab until all unsatisfactory conditions have been corrected if the vehicle does not pass inspection within 30 days from the date of the original unsatisfactory inspection the certificate shall be revoked  business license required nothing contained in the chapter shall be construed to eliminate or replace the requirement that any person doing business in the city must obtain a business license  reserved violations the violation of any provision of this chapter shall be punishable in accordance with section 19 of this ordinances  reserved inasmuch as taxi service is based upon public convenience and necessity when a call for service has been made by a person on a private property it shall be unlawful for any person or agent or employee of a business to deny entry or access to a property where other public transportation vehicle or vehicles for hire are invited to enter or to require or demand a fee from a taxicab operator to pick up or discharge passengers at their place of business  implementation all certificates issued on or before the effective date of this article shall become void on  immediately following the effective date of this ordinance all certificate holders will be given written notice to surrender their existing certificates to the police chief have each taxicab inspected and obtain a new certificate for each taxicab which was authorized under the existing certificates in order to obtain the new certificates the holders will be required to present each vehicle at the police department for inspection the police chief will notify the certificate holder of the time and place that the inspection will be performed a fee equal to one half the annual renewal fee for certificates will be required to be paid at the time of inspection if the certificate holder fails to present a vehicle for inspection and pay the required fee as scheduled or to obtain prior approval of the police chief for an alternate schedule no new certificate will be issued for the vehicle in question to pass inspection the vehicle must be in proper operating condition and meet all requirements for the issuance of a taxicab decal the police inspector will record the year make model and vehicle identification number from each vehicle and issue a new certificate for each qualified vehicle not to exceed the number of vehicles authorized on the old certificate no certificates will be issued for taxicabs that are not presented as scheduled and approved before   secs 23472349  reserved article iii  limousines definitions the following words or phrases as used in this article shall have the meanings as set out in this section unless a different meaning clearly appears from the context limousine means any vehicle having a seating capacity of not more than 15 passengers including a chauffeur and used to transport passengers for compensation but not including any vehicle operated as a taxicab as defined and regulated in article ii of this chapter or any vehicle for hire which is operated or required to be operated pursuant to a franchise authorized by city council or which is operated pursuant to a class a or class b motor vehicle carrier certificate issued by the state public service commission or medical transports limousine business means the business of transporting passengers for compensation by limousine    license required no person shall operate a limousine business within the city unless he or she has a valid current business license issued by the city business license inspector  chauffeurs permit it shall be unlawful for any person operating a limousine in the city to carry any passenger for any form of compensation unless he or she shall have a current city chauffeurs permit in addition to any motor vehicle operators license required by the state the current city chauffeurs permit shall be prominently displayed in the limousine at all times when passengers are being transported for compensation the application for issuance denial suspension and revocation of chauffeurs permits shall be governed by the applicable provisions of article ii of this chapter which govern the issuance of taxi drivers permits  limousine decal any person operating a limousine business shall purchase one limousine decal from the city for each vehicle to be operated as a limousine in the city the cost of each decal shall be $500 such decal shall be issued by the city business license inspector and shall expire each year on may 31 it shall be unlawful to operate a limousine in the city unless a current limousine decal purchased from the city is displayed on the lower right side of the front windshield of the vehicle  solicitation of passengers a no person shall solicit passengers for a limousine by cruising the streets b no person shall operate a limousine on the streets of the city or park anywhere within the city where it can be seen from a public rightofway bearing any sign or message proclaiming availability or that the limousine is for hire or stating the price for hiring the limousine c no person shall park a limousine on any public property in anticipation of a call for service or without a current contract for hire or call for service d no person shall operate a limousine in a regulated taxi stand or taxi line without having been summoned to the location by a specifically identified customer who is waiting for service e no person shall operate a limousine bearing any marking other than that required by the public service commission and such shall not exceed three inches in height no marking shall solicit business by way of sign lettering message text graphic markings phone numbers or addresses    records required each limousine business shall maintain a daily manifest record on which shall be recorded the time and place of origin destination of each trip all stops during the trip at which passengers entered or exited the limousine and the drivers identity all such records shall be maintained by the operator of the limousine business for a period of four years and made available to the chief of police or his designee for inspection and copying on request  fares limousine fares shall be agreed to by the passenger or passengers prior to entering the limousine unless the fare agreement is in writing and signed by the passenger or is collected prior to commencement of service it will be presumed that no agreement was reached as required herein  exception nothing in this article shall apply to the operation of a limousine by a business exclusively to provide transportation for clients or customers to and from that business places of business and which is not otherwise for hire specifically including the operating of a limousine in connection with a funeral  prohibitions specific to limousines a no person shall operate a limousine in the same manner as a taxicab by responding to a call or demand for a taxicab b no person shall dispatch a limousine to a call or demand for a taxicab c no person shall respond to a call or demand for a taxicab in a person other than the vehicle owner authorized operator or authorized agent of the owner  and include a legal repossession nonconsensual tows also include those directed by law enforcement notow fee means a charge by a towing company which has been summoned to the private property by the private property owner and has actually entered the boundary of the property but has not yet accomplished coupling the vehicle for towing payperuse parking lots means real property on which a business entity collects a fee for parking a defined period of time either by attendant or device that identifies the pay for use spaces and collects the payment instantaneously on the scene payperuse lots that engage in nonconsensual towing are regulated herein person means an individual a sole proprietorship partnership corporation limited liability company or any other business entity personal property means health and human care related devices such as child care related items such as strollers car seats diaper bags and childrens clothing andor personal mobility assistance devices such as walkers crutches and the like health related items such as medicine delivery systems and devices medications prescriptions and wallets personal handbags and identity papers such as a persons drivers licenses identity cards social security cards tax records or other documents that are recognized as subjecting one to identity theft when misused the vehicle the other property contained therein not related to health and human care or that is attached thereto to the vehicle as radios speaker and the like may be subject to lien as set forth in sc   provided however the inclusion of articles left in a vehicle which may statutorily subject to sale to satisfy a lien when left in the vehicle is not interpreted to grant a towing entity authority to withhold personal property as defined herein from its owner police directed tow shall mean the removal and storage of a wrecked or disabled vehicles at the direction of policelaw enforcement from an accident scene or removal arising from arrest or the removal and storage of a vehicle in the event the vehicle owner or authorized driver is incapacitated unavailable or otherwise does not consent to the removal of the vehicle excepting however all incidents of nonconsensual towing from private parking lots and acts of legal repossession as herein defined private parking lot means any private parking lot or area owned by a business entity or an apartment complex or other recognized group parking entity who has the legal right to exclude persons not in membership or association with the entity or that have not paid or has parked beyond the paid time private property owner shall mean the person unconnected with the towing or wrecker business who has deed title or leasehold interest or those duly authorized agents managers security personnel and other employees to whom authority has been delegated to manage a payperuse lot or a private parking lot and to sign the towing authorization for 1 a business related private property lot associated with a business license holder or 2 a licensed business operation of payperuse parking lot or 3 a parking lot serving an apartment complex condominium complex and like primarily residential uses towing shall mean the consensual or nonconsensual engagement or act of moving one vehicle from one point to another including hookup lift and transport using what is commonly referred to as a tow wrecker or a car carrier for which a service charge is made either directly or indirectly vehicle means a conveyance of any kind whether or not motorized which is designed to transport people or property vehicle owner means the person or business in whom the vehicle is registered or the person to whom the vehicle has been entrusted or allowed to operate by the title owner or an authorized agent of the owner wrecker means any vehicle built and equipped for the purpose of towing lifting pulling or otherwise transferring vehicles from place to place wrecker service means the business its officers agents employees and vehicle operators towing a vehicle located in the city limits or storing a vehicle in a lot within the city limits no person employed by appointed by or affiliated with a wrecker service may be an agent for a private property owner  license and decal required a business license required any person or entity desiring to operate a wrecker service or engage in the act of towing including repossessions within the city shall first obtain a city business license by filing an application upon a form provided by the city with the city business license inspector together with the appropriate license fee as set forth in this from the application the applicant will attach the following information under affirmation and signature 1 business identity a indicate the nature of the business identity such as a soleproprietorship partnership or corporation  list all individuals or entities having a financial interest in the company including names physical addresses and telephone numbers b indicate whether business is the legal repossession business consensual towing arising from an vehicle repairstorage business  or in nonconsensual towing arising from acts of legal repossession or removal of illegally parked vehicles on private property either on an oncall or contractual basis any act of nonconsensual towing disqualifies a business from claiming that it only engages in consensual towing c the business shall declare if it offers after hour redemption and under what circumstances 2 business location provide the street location mailing address and telephone number of the wrecker services primary business location if different from the storage or redemption location the business location shall display a notice to the public which provides the rates permitted for a nonconsensual tow the physical address of the storage lot if different from the business location and a contact number for the police department 3 normal business hours declare the normal business hours based on the classification of business as consent only towing or nonconsensual towing 4 storage lots provide the street location address and telephone number of the wrecker services storage lots or location for redemption or retrieval if different from the business location a the capacity of storage shall be indicated together with the method employed to screen the stored motor vehicles from public view as well as security measures employed b except for legal repossessions in order to be licensed to engage in nonconsensual towing within the city limits the wrecker service is required to have its storage lot within the city limits c an attendant must be on premises on duty during normal business hours d storage lot signage must prominently display the normal business hours as declared defined and required herein towing and storage rates as established by the city a contact number for the police department and if the wrecker service advertises an after hours redemption or release a telephone number where the owner manager or attendant of the towing storage lot may be reached at any time so that after normal business hours redemption and release can occur e if after hours redemption and storage is available to consumers the owner manager or attendant of the towing storage lot shall respond within one hour of contact f if it is an outdoor storage facility it must be lighted from dusk to dawn sufficiently illuminated to enable a vehicle owner to inspect a vehicle prior to redemption or release 5 records and other services list all procedures and attach copies of forms used to keep records and any auxiliary services which will ensure delivery of a high level of service to the public 6 contracts for towing copies of all contracts for nonconsensual towing with private property owners 7 vehicle identification provide the year make model vehicle identification number gross vehicle weight class type and south carolina license plate number for each vehicle to be used in the applicants business 8 liability insurance provide proof of automobile liability in full compliance with south carolina financial responsibility laws 9 towing decal a towing decal shall be issued with the business license the citys final refusal to issue a decal or the suspension or revocation of a decal shall not be made except upon reasonable notice of not less than 30 days after application to the applicant or registrant and an opportunity for the applicant or registrant to be heard the city may refuse to issue or may suspend or revoke any decal issued upon proof that the applicant or holder of the decal if the applicant is an entity a person with a substantial interest in the applicant or holder of a registration or any towing company in which such person was a person with a substantial interest and was serving in such capacity at the time the conduct or conviction required to be disclosed pursuant to this subsection occurred a has obtained a decal deception or misrepresentation  b has engaged in the use or employment of dishonesty fraud deception misrepresentation false promise or false pretense in exercising the authority to tow granted by the decal  c has engaged in gross negligence causing or gross incompetence resulting in personal injury to a person or property damage while exercising the authority to tow granted by the decal  d has engaged in repeated acts of negligence or incompetence  e has engaged in professional or occupational misconduct arising from the exercise of authority granted by the decal  f has had the authority to engage in the activity regulated by this article revoked or suspended by any other state agency or authority for reasons consistent with this section  g has been convicted of motor vehicle burglary or theft    special requirements a every wrecker or roll back shall carry a broom shovel and container for debris each shall also carry a fire extinguisher rated for class a b and c fires b after being summoned to the scene of an accident it shall be the responsibility of the wrecker service to perform a cleanup of the accident area before leaving this responsibility requires the wrecker service to remove all debris such as broken glass liquids and materials from an accident area by sweeping up such debris and removing this material from the scene in a garbage can type container on each wrecker c in addition to the items required above each wrecker shall also carry commercial material and all other equipment to fulfill this responsibility d each wrecker shall display the owner or company name and business telephone number in letters not less than two inches high on both vehicle doors temporary lettering magnetic or otherwise is strictly prohibited e each wrecker shall affix on the front windshield a city issued decal which evidences a business license and authorizing the wrecker to operate within the city of myrtle beach  prohibitions a it shall be unlawful for any person to offer to perform or engage or attempt to engage in the wrecker service business or the act of towing within the city limits of myrtle beach except under the authority of a current business license and a towing decal issued by the city of myrtle beach b it shall be unlawful for a wrecker service to go to the scene or location of a disabled or damaged motor vehicle or the location of any accident unless summoned by the vehicles owner the owner or person in charge of the property where the vehicle is disabled or by the police department c it shall be unlawful for a wrecker service to enter the vehicle whether locked or unlocked except under police directed tows d excepting lawful repossession it shall be unlawful to remove any vehicle that is parked on any road highway or other public property unless summoned by the vehicles owner or authorized by the police department to do so e it shall be unlawful for vehicles used for legal repossession to be used in other nonconsensual towing unless they are made to be in compliance with section 23127 f it shall be unlawful for a wrecker service to operate any emergency lights except at the scene of an accident while hooking up to the vehicle to be towed or while actually towing a vehicle emergency lights shall not be operated while on route to any accident scene or other service call g it shall be unlawful to tow a motor vehicle from within the city limits to a storage facility or store such vehicle at a storage facility unless the storage facility is in compliance with section 23126 as inspected and approved by the police department h it shall be unlawful for a person to take or receive any benefit or advantage including a pecuniary benefit kickback or reward from a wrecker service for providing information about motor vehicles parked for unauthorized purposes on privately owned property or otherwise in connection with towing from privately owned property motor vehicles parked without authorization this prohibition does not prevent private property owners and wrecker services from contracting for towing services i it shall be unlawful for a wrecker service to offer or make any benefit or advantage including a pecuniary benefit kickback or reward to a private property owner or any person for providing information about motor vehicles parked for unauthorized purposes on privately owned property or otherwise in connection with towing from privately owned property motor vehicles parked without authorization this prohibition does not prevent private property owners and wrecker services from contracting for towing services j it shall be unlawful for anyone to obstruct or interfere with a wrecker service that is carrying out a tow on private property or a tow conducted pursuant to a contract with the city occupying the vehicle after the vehicle has been coupled or positioning oneself or another vehicle to block the wreckers exit is an obstruction and interference and may be subject to arrest or the issuance of an ordinance summons or uniform traffic ticket upon observation by law enforcement k it shall be unlawful for a wrecker service or any employee agent or person acting on behalf of the wrecker service either as a pedestrian or as a driver or passenger in any vehicle to patrol or park along or in any streets highways or a private parking lots in scouting soliciting or in anticipation of wrecker or towing services being summoned l it shall be unlawful for any wrecker service or any employee agent or person acting on behalf of the wrecker service to refuse to release personal property as defined herein upon request during normal business hours or in an after hours release event if the wrecker service has after hours release m it shall be unlawful for any private property owner or wrecker service to omit fail or neglect to perform any duty or obligation imposed by this article  violations to serve as grounds for business license suspension or revocation the chief of police shall inform the city business license inspector as to any violations under this chapter so the business license administrator may revoke or suspend any business license issued for towing service if he determines that the public interest so requires and when it is found after investigation that the license has been mistakenly or improperly issued or issued in violation of a city ordinance  or the licensee has breached any condition upon which his license was issued or has failed to comply with the provisions of this article  or the licensee has obtained his license fraud or misrepresentation a false or misleading statement or evasion or suppression of a material fact in his application  or the licensee has been convicted of an offense under a law or ordinance regulating businesses  or the licensee has engaged in an unlawful activity or nuisance related to the business including violations of applicable zoning laws  removal of disabled or abandoned vehicles  police directed tows the city manager shall be responsible for insuring that disabled or abandoned vehicles and police directed tows are removed from the public rightsofway or other public property in a timely manner to serve the health safety and general welfare of the public in order to accomplish this purpose the city manager shall have the authority to contract with one or more private companies to provide wrecker services to the city or may within budgetary constraints provide such services with city equipment and personnel any such contract for wrecker services shall contain but not be limited to provisions for the following 1 full compliance with the provisions of this chapter 2 standards for response times to calls for services and requirements for 24hour service and availability for release of towed vehicles 3 storage area requirements 4 insurance and indemnification requirements to protect the citys interests 5 recordkeeping requirements 6 special equipment requirements  city council approval before entering into any contract pursuant to section 23130 for continuing wrecker services the city manager shall submit the contract to city council for approval  provided however that the city manager shall retain the right to enter into short term agreements for removal of vehicles from city rightsofway and other public property when necessary to ensure the public health and safety  payment methods for services rendered for all tows a for services rendered or for any fee or to redeem a motor vehicle from storage the operator shall accept in payment either cash a check issued by an insurance company a valid debit card or a valid major credit card or charge card subject to the provisions of subsection b of this section b with any type of payment card the wrecker operator may request additional identification by the presentation of state issued drivers license unless the motorist is unable to produce such identification or the operator has a bona fide reason to believe the card or other identification is fictitious altered stolen expired or revoked or not valid for any other cause or is clearly offered with intent to defraud the issuer the debit card charge card or credit card shall be deemed an acceptable form of payment in lieu of cash if the operator ordinarily accepts the card at his place of business the wrecker operator shall notify the police when payment is declined due to a determination that the card or other identification is fictitious altered stolen expired or revoked or not valid for any other cause or is clearly offered with intent to defraud the issuer nothing in this ordinance shall preclude payment by a motorist in the form of cash check or money order if this form of payment is acceptable to the operator  secs 2313323139  reserved division 2  nonconsensual towing nonconsensual towing requirements and restrictions  duties and obligations a excepting the act of legal possession a wrecker service shall not engage in towing from a payperuse lot or private property unless the private property owner has personally summoned the wrecker service to perform an act of towing of a particular vehicle b the private property owner shall verify that proper signage is in place prior to summoning the wrecker service c the wrecker service shall not block the exit of a vehicle from a parking lot or begin the act of coupling the vehicles until after the private property owner has written the time of the towing and then signed a fully executed authorization for such removal within 30 minutes immediately prior to the towing d the written authorization shall contain the location and reason for the tow the authorizing persons name the exact time of the tow the make model year color vehicle identification vin and license plate number e authorization forms shall be provided by each wrecker service providing such towing services and will be kept on file by the wrecker service for inspection by the city for not less than three years f except for legal repossession and police directed tows any wrecker service that has entered the boundaries of the private property but has not initiated coupling shall upon the request of the vehicle owner release said vehicle upon payment of the notow fee on the scene if the vehicle owner refuses or is unable to pay the no tow fee the wrecker service may tow the vehicle personal property as defined herein may be retrieved without cost or fee on the scene at any time prior to the wrecker leaving the lot without regard to payment on the scene g except for legal repossession and police directed tows any wrecker service that has initiated coupling but has not completely removed the vehicle from the private property shall upon the request of the vehicle owner release said vehicle upon payment of the decoupling fee on the scene if the vehicle owner refuses or is unable to pay the decoupling fee the wrecker service may tow the vehicle personal property as defined herein may be retrieved without cost or fee on the scene at any time prior to the wrecker leaving the lot without regard to payment on the scene h excepting police directed tows upon exiting the private property the wrecker service must proceed directly to the final storage location no vehicle may be stored temporarily or staged at any other location prior to removal to the identified final storage location i in compliance with sc  any wrecker service performing a nonconsensual tow shall immediately telephone the police department not later than one hour of the time of the tow as set forth by the private property owner on the authorization and the location of the tow the authorizing private property manager the towing service and wrecker operator and the address of the storage location j after payment of all fees and in any event of release possession of the keys to the vehicle together with a valid state issued drivers license shall constitute a prima facie presumption that the person presenting such evidence is authorized to accept release the wrecker service may make a photocopy of the license k the wrecker service shall allow the vehicle owner to retrieve personal property without a requirement for that the towing and storage fees be paid before releasing the personal property l the wrecker service is not required to return the vehicle or their personal property to the person after the companys normal business hours as declared in the application for license and decal per section 23126 and per state law sc  should the wrecker service elect to provide for after hour redemptions an additional fee is allowed only as set forth herein all payments are to be receipted m should the operator of the vehicle seek information on the towing from the private property owner the private property owner is required to provide a copy of this article and the contact information for the wrecker service and the police department n if a vehicle is towed as a result of a private property owners request and the private property owner has not complied with the requirements provided in this article or if the vehicle is shown to have been legally parked the private property owner shall be guilty of a misdemeanor and may in the discretion of the municipal judge as provided in sc  be subject to reimburse the vehicle owner for all towing and storage charges which the vehicle owner paid o if a vehicle is towed as a result of a private property owners request and the wrecker service has not complied with the requirements provided in this article the wrecker service operator shall be guilty of a misdemeanor and may in the discretion of the municipal judge as provided in sc  be subject to reimburse the vehicle owner for all towing and storage charges which the vehicle owner paid  uniform signage requirements for notice of towing a private property owners shall post signage indicating that nonconsensual towing may occur this signage is not required to be posted by individual singlefamily homeowners or renters b the sign shall be constructed of metal plastic or other type of material that is enduring in nature signage on a property shall be consistent in appearance and content the police department shall provide a template for such signs for use by the private property owners indicating requirements for size materials placements and wording any exceptions to this template must be approved in writing by the police chief    limited nonconsensual towing fees a at any time a vehicle is towed without the authorization of the vehicle owner from a payperuse parking lot or private parking lot or private property the following fees shall be the maximum to be charged by any wrecker operator or company and no other fees or charges of any kind shall be required to be paid by the vehicle owner of the vehicle in order to recover the vehicle 1 the fee for each tow is a flat fee and shall be all inclusive there shall not be any additional fees assessed by the towing service for using dollies trailers lifts slim jims or any other equipment or service including release or retrieval fees 2 no private property owner or wrecker service may assess any additional cost or fee nor characterize any further recourse as being in the nature of a fine 3 the assessment of storage fee shall not commence for 24 hours from the time the police department is contacted as required by sc  for that time there shall be no assessment of a storage fee and only the towing fee shall be assessed for release b class a wreckercar carrier fees towing any motor vehicle or trailer 10000 pounds gvw or less per tow  $16000 storage after 12 hours  2500 per 24hour period no tow fee  3000 decoupling fee  4500 after hours vehicle redemption or release of personal property if offered  3000 c class d wrecker fees towing per tow  $25000 storage after 12 hours  3000 per 24hour period no tow fee  6000 decoupling fee  12000 after hours vehicle redemption or release of personal property if offered  3000  effectivity applicability and validity if any section subsection clause or provision of this act shall be adjudged unconstitutional or to be ineffective in whole or in part to the extent that it is not adjudged unconstitutional or is not ineffective it shall be valid and effective and no other section subsection clause or provision of this act shall on account thereof be deemed invalid or ineffective and the applicability or invalidity of any section subsection clause or provision of this act in any one or more instances or under any one or more circumstances shall not be taken to affect or prejudice in any way its applicability or validity in any other instance or under any other circumstances  secs 2314423149  reserved article vii  animaldrawn vehicles for hire general regulations it shall be illegal to operate any vehicle which is pulled or drawn by a horse mule or other beast of burden within the city for the purpose of transporting passengers unless that vehicle shall have a valid current license issued by the city pursuant to the provisions of this chapter  certificate of convenience and necessity a no animaldrawn vehicle for hire shall be licensed to do business in or use the streets of the city unless there shall first have been obtained from the city council a certificate of public convenience and necessity therefor b an applicant for a certificate of public convenience and necessity for the operation of an animaldrawn vehicle for hire shall include in the application detailed information concerning the specific type vehicle to be used the specific area or areas of the city within which operations shall be conducted the routes to be used and the hours and days of the week the animaldrawn vehicle may be operated issuance of the certificate of public convenience and necessity shall be conditioned on strict compliance with the areas routes and times approved or modified by city council city council may further condition the certificate to regulate the method of operation of animaldrawn vehicles for hire as may be considered necessary to insure proper traffic flow and public safety within the specific area to be served c each applicant shall certify as a condition for the issuance of a certificate of public convenience and necessity that 1 all vehicles to be operated pursuant to the certificate shall be maintained in a safe and sanitary condition at all times  and 2 no one shall be permitted to operate the vehicles who is not at least 18 years old  who does not possess a valid license to operate a motor vehicle issued by the state of south carolina  who has been convicted of a major crime or the violation of laws or ordinances involving moral turpitude  or who has a record of habitually violating traffic laws or ordinances d the city council may when in its judgment the public interest and safety require it issue or refuse to issue to any applicant a certificate of public convenience and necessity or upon notice and after hearing may for like cause revoke or modify any such certificate theretofore issued in case such certificate is revoked the city treasurer shall remit to the holder of such revoked certificate the unearned portion of any license tax paid to the city by such certificate holder e in determining whether public convenience and necessity require licensing of such animaldrawn vehicles for hire for which application may be made the city council shall take into consideration whether the demands of the public require the proposed or additional service within the city the financial responsibility of the applicant the number kind and type of equipment the increased traffic congestion and demand for increased parking space upon the streets of the city which may result whether the safe use of the streets by the public both vehicular and pedestrian will be preserved by the granting of such additional licenses and such other relevant facts as the city council may deem advisable or necessary council shall also consider the applicants proposed procedures for care and protection of the health of the animals and may impose additional requirements in the certificate the burden of showing public convenience and necessity shall rest upon the applicant  license requirements upon presentation of evidence that a certificate of public convenience and necessity has been granted by city council the business license inspector shall issue to the certificate holder a license for each animaldrawn vehicle to be operated up to the number authorized in the certificate at the same rate as for taxicabs  liability and indemnification a as a condition for the issuance of any license pursuant to the provisions of this chapter the licensee shall agree to indemnify the city its agents and employees from and against all claims damages losses and expenses including attorneys fees arising out of or resulting from the operation of any licensed vehicle for hire b before any license is issued for the operation of an animaldrawn vehicle for hire the owner shall file with the city clerk a copy of a policy of liability insurance issued by a company authorized to do business in this state providing for at least the minimum coverage limits required for motor vehicles in this state  operating regulations a it shall be illegal to operate any animaldrawn vehicle for hire on any city street or rightofway unless a current valid license certificate issued by the business license inspector is prominently displayed within the vehicle b all animaldrawn vehicles for hire must be operated in strict compliance with the provisions of the certificate of public convenience and necessity pursuant to which the license was issued c all traffic regulations of the city and of the state must be strictly complied with d all operators of animaldrawn vehicles for hire shall comply with the following sanitation requirements 1 all horses mules and other animals shall be equipped with adequate devices to prevent manure and other excrement from falling upon the streets of the city any excrement which falls upon the streets of the city shall be removed at the expense of licensee 2 all animal waste for disposal shall be promptly transported to sites or facilities legally empowered to accept it for treatment or disposal 3 a licensee shall further comply with all applicable health and sanitation requirements of the state and all rules and regulations promulgated by the state e each animaldrawn vehicle for hire shall be kept in a safe and sanitary condition at all times the city shall have the right to inspect or cause to be inspected any animaldrawn vehicle as often as may be necessary for the purpose of ascertaining and causing to be corrected any unsafe or unsanitary conditions or any violations of this chapter or any other rule regulations ordinance or law relating to the operation of such animaldrawn vehicles f all animaldrawn vehicles used by a licensee shall have conspicuously displayed on the exterior of the vehicle the name of the licensee or the trade name under which the vehicle is operated no signs other than those required by this article shall be allowed on any animaldrawn vehicle  time and place limitations the operation of animaldrawn vehicles for limited as provided in section 128 of this ordinances  appendix a  zoning footnotes  1  editors
